interestingFact: There are 195 countries in the world today, including 193 United Nations member states and 2 observer states.
Nepal is home to Mount Everest, the tallest mountain in the world, standing at 8,848 meters.
The Pyramids of Giza are one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.
Australia is home to the Great Barrier Reef, the largest coral reef system in the world.
Brazil is home to the Amazon Rainforest, the largest tropical rainforest in the world.
The Eiffel Tower in Paris was once the tallest man-made structure in the world.
Russia is the largest country in the world by area, covering more than 17 million square kilometers.
The Great Wall of China is visible from space on rare occasions.
Germany is the world's second-largest exporter of goods after China.
The UK is known for its monarchy and has a long history of influence in global politics and culture.
Italy is home to the most UNESCO World Heritage Sites in the world.
Mexico introduced chocolate, chilies, and corn to the world.
South Korea is known for its K-pop music, which has gained massive global popularity.
Russia is the largest country by land area, spanning over 17 million square kilometers.
China is the world's most populous country and has one of the oldest civilizations.
Spain is known for its vibrant culture, including flamenco dancing, bullfighting, and its world-famous cuisine.
Egypt is home to the ancient pyramids, one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.
Argentina is famous for its tango dance and is one of the worldâ€™s leading wine producers.
South Africa is the only country in the world to have hosted the World Cup, the Olympic Games, and the Cricket World Cup.
Nigeria is the most populous country in Africa and one of the largest oil producers in the world.
Saudi Arabia is the birthplace of Islam and home to the two holiest cities in the religion, Mecca and Medina.
Turkey is a transcontinental country, straddling both Europe and Asia.
Indonesia is the largest archipelago in the world, with over 17,000 islands.
